paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses two missense variants in BRCA2, specifically BRCA2:c.91T>G (p.Trp31Gly), detailing their potential pathogenicity and functional effects.

patients.phenotype: breast cancer at a young age

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Both these probands developed breast cancer at a young age and reported a close relative affected with early onset breast cancer (≤ 40 years).

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2:p.Trp31Gly variant was shown to prevent the BRCA2-PALB2 binding in functional assays.

variants.segregation_data: Not able to ascertain other family members to be genotyped in order to attempt co-segregation analyses.
variants.population_frequency: Not found in public databases such as GnomAD and 1000 genomes.
variants.evidence_level: Initial evidence in favor of pathogenicity based on functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was annotated in ClinVar as a VUS.
key_quotes: The BRCA2:p.Trp31Gly and the PALB2:p.Pro1088Ser variants were originally identified in two different Italian breast cancer probands born in Milano and Bergamo, respectively.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extraction was straightforward as the relevant data was clearly presented in the text.
